channel.title: Dead Interactions - Splitting the Difference (Simple Proposal)
channel.description:
If there will be *zero* dead interactions, here is a simple proposal:
- **_Allow the dead to see all whispers._**
Here is what this would accomplish:
- Allows dead to better observe/comment on gameplay choices and to openly discuss the game between factions.
- Something to look *forward* to after dying. ("Damn, I got killed - let's see what's going on behind the scenes!")
- No risk of this knowledge impacting the game, since there are *zero* interactions between living and dead.
This would make death more interesting as well as increase the opportunity to analyze and discuss gameplay.

item.title: Dead Interactions - Splitting the Difference (Simple Proposal)
item.dc:creator: TinyDeer
item.description:
You and I sharply disagree on this issue, and I appreciate your pushing for what you believe so strongly.

I need to experience firsthand that the removal is a disaster before pushing Bos to reverse his decision. If I’m wrong and it’s as bad as you say, then I will certainly admit my mistake.

If he won’t reverse his decision, though, then I would love to see this proposal implemented. Other than taking cheaters into account, I don’t see any harm whatsoever in letting the dead see what’s going on behind the scenes.

item.title: Dead Interactions - Splitting the Difference (Simple Proposal)
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
Absolutely not. This will only confuse people further when the dead-interaction patch gets reverted; the game shouldn’t be designed or balanced around untenable changes. The important thing now is to keep pushing, hard, to stop the changes from happening, and to keep pushing hard to get them reverted when they role out, not to try and accommodate them.

item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Yeah, unfortunately the existance of cheaters makes it a no-go. Stream sniping and intentional out of game communication make giving extra information to the dead a solid no go IMO.

I’m much more in favor of post game replay downloads that announce everything etc… which I know while they don’t give more fun to waiting for the game to end, they do give an awesome way to review all sides of a game, with effectively 0 risk of it being abused by cheaters.
